title: Differential Geometry
text:
Welcome
These are the Lecture Notes of Numbers, Sequences & Series 400297 for T1 2023/24 at the University of Hull. I will follow these lecture notes during the course. If you have any question or find any typo, please email me at
Up to date information about the course, Tutorials and Homework will be published on the University of Hull Canvas Website
and on the Course Webpage hosted on my website
Features of these digital notes:

title: Differential Geometry
text:
Readings
We will study the set of real numbers \(\mathbb{R}\), and then sequences and series in \(\mathbb{R}\). I will follow mainly the textbook by Bartle and Sherbert [1]. Another good reading is the book by Abbott [2]. I also point out the classic book by Rudin [3], although this is more difficult to understand.






Important



You are not expected to purchase any of the above books. These lecture notes will cover 100% of the topics you are expected to known in order to excel in the final exam.






[1] R.G. Bartle, D.R. Sherbert, Introduction to real analysis, Fourth Edition, Wiley, 2011.


[2] S. Abbott, Understanding analysis, Second Edition, Springer, 2015.


[3] W. Rudin, Principles of mathematical analysis, Third Edition, McGraw Hill, 1976.
